predicate.note: Frames file for 'reel' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. Well butter my butt and call me a biscuit, it is in verbnet: class 40.8.2. No mention of other members. Comparison to ergative usage of 'shake'.

example.name: ordinary ergative
example.text: For, just as Mr. Giuliani latches on to an issue that has Mr. Dinkins reeling, ...

example.name: with cause
example.text: Columbia Savings & Loan Association, *trace* reeling from thrift-accounting changes mandated by Congress and the recent collapse of the junk-bond market, announced a loss for the third quarter of $226.3 million, or $11.57 a share.
example.arg: thrift-accounting changes mandated by Congress and the recent collapse of the junk-bond market

roleset.name: enumerate, announce

example.name: automatically generated
example.text: The U.S. automotive loss was a sharp reversal for a company that *trace* had reeled off 12 consecutive quarters of improved earnings until the 1989 second quarter.

roleset.note: This is an odd usage of 'reel off', imho.
